title: Understanding Schizophreniform Disorder
text: Schizophreniform disorder is a mental health condition that shares symptoms with schizophrenia but differs in duration.

title: Duration of Symptoms
text: The key difference between schizophreniform disorder and schizophrenia is the duration of symptoms. Schizophreniform disorder lasts for a shorter period.

title: Symptoms to Look For
text: Symptoms include delusions, hallucinations, disorganized speech, disorganized behavior, and negative symptoms.

hintAnswer: at least one month but less than six months
title: Duration of Schizophreniform Disorder
text: How long do the symptoms of schizophreniform disorder need to be present for a diagnosis?
choices: at least one month but less than six months

title: Identifying the Correct Disorder
text: Which disorder is characterized by the presence of delusions, hallucinations, disorganized speech, disorganized behavior, and negative symptoms for at least one month but less than six months?
choices: psychotic disorder due to a medical condition
